docs.abstract: Three Federal Reserve rate cuts and a rally in huge tech stocks like Apple have helped lift the S&P 500 by 29 percent so far in 2019.
docs.snippet: Three Federal Reserve rate cuts and a rally in huge tech stocks like Apple have helped lift the S&P 500 by 29 percent so far in 2019.
docs.lead_paragraph: The world is enmeshed in a trade war. The president has been impeached. The tech industry is under attack from regulators worldwide. But this year investors said: So what? The stock market is closing in on its best year in two decades. With only two days of trading to go, the S&P 500 could fare better than it has since 1997. Stock prices have been buoyed by a mere whiff of optimism that the economy — despite occasional hiccups and dire prognostications by so-called experts — will keep chugging along. And the Federal Reserve deserves credit, too, for cutting interest rates despite scowls from a White House that wanted more. So far this year, the S&P is up 29 percent. But the market crept up gradually as investors felt their way through the turbulent year, interrupted only by a handful of short-lived retreats. Since mid-October, stocks haven’t had a single daily gain of more than 1 percent. Even on Friday, the increase was tiny, but it left the index at a record and capped a fifth consecutive week of gains.

headline.main: Stocks Are on the Verge of the Best Year Since 1997
headline.print_headline: S&P Closes In On Best Year In 2 Decades

docs.abstract: The ride-hailing company “permitted a culture of sexual harassment and retaliation,” the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission found.
docs.snippet: The ride-hailing company “permitted a culture of sexual harassment and retaliation,” the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission found.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In 2017, a former Uber employee wrote a public essay describing how the ride-hailing company had permitted sexual harassment to fester at the workplace.

headline.main: Uber Settles Federal Investigation Into Workplace Culture
headline.print_headline: Uber Agrees  To Fix Flaws  In Its Culture

docs.abstract: Lilium, a German start-up, illustrates the potential and the risks of creating a new generation of electric aircraft for urban transportation.
docs.snippet: Lilium, a German start-up, illustrates the potential and the risks of creating a new generation of electric aircraft for urban transportation.
docs.lead_paragraph: MUNICH — Inside an airplane hangar about 20 miles from central Munich, Daniel Wiegand lifted the door of a prototype that he said would become one of the world’s first flying taxis. He’s coy about how much it cost to build — “several million,” he says — but promises that within five years a fleet of them could provide a 10-minute trip from Manhattan to Kennedy International Airport for $70.

headline.main: Inside the High-Stakes Race to Build the World’s First Flying Taxi
headline.print_headline: High-Wire Act to Build World’s First Flying Taxi

docs.abstract: As an industry begins to sprout, Kiwi Campus and Nuro, two start-ups, are dreaming up new ways to deliver groceries and lunch.
docs.snippet: As an industry begins to sprout, Kiwi Campus and Nuro, two start-ups, are dreaming up new ways to deliver groceries and lunch.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERKELEY, Calif. — Come lunchtime on the campus of the University of California, Berkeley, thousands of students rush out for a bite to eat and head back to class. But for more than a year, a few hundred have stayed put and instead summoned a knee-high robot bearing a burrito, a burger or other meals from a nearby restaurant.

headline.main: Burrito Delivered by Bot, as Long as Students Don’t Trap It
headline.print_headline: On Berkeley’s Sidewalks, Bots With Burritos

docs.abstract: Her policy would make it much harder for people to remain multibillionaires into old age. Here’s what that would look like for Bill Gates and others.
docs.snippet: Her policy would make it much harder for people to remain multibillionaires into old age. Here’s what that would look like for Bill Gates and others.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Monday. (Was this email forwarded to you? Sign up here.)

headline.main: Running the Numbers on Elizabeth Warren’s Wealth Tax

docs.abstract: Art Peck, who was viewed as a beacon of digital expertise, is leaving the company after less than five years in the top role.
docs.snippet: Art Peck, who was viewed as a beacon of digital expertise, is leaving the company after less than five years in the top role.
docs.lead_paragraph: Art Peck, who has been the chief executive of Gap Inc. since 2015, is leaving the company after 15 years and will be replaced on an interim basis by Robert J. Fisher, its nonexecutive chairman and a son of the couple who founded the retailer.

headline.main: Gap C.E.O. Steps Down in Abrupt Exit
headline.print_headline: Chief Executive of Gap Makes an Abrupt Exit

docs.abstract: Dara Khosrowshahi, Uber’s chief executive, is pushing employees to do more with less and to perform better, as he battles skepticism over the ride-hailing firm’s business.
docs.snippet: Dara Khosrowshahi, Uber’s chief executive, is pushing employees to do more with less and to perform better, as he battles skepticism over the ride-hailing firm’s business.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A few days after Uber went public in May and its stock fell into a tailspin, the ride-hailing company’s chief executive, Dara Khosrowshahi, sent a rallying message to employees.

headline.main: Uber Fights to Get Its Edge Back
headline.print_headline: Uber Fights to Get Edge Back as Shares Suffer

docs.abstract: The Huntsman family just made a $150 million gift for mental health research and care. The father had concentrated his donations on cancer research.
docs.snippet: The Huntsman family just made a $150 million gift for mental health research and care. The father had concentrated his donations on cancer research.
docs.lead_paragraph: This week, the Huntsman family — one of the most philanthropic in the United States — made a $150 million gift to the University of Utah to establish the Huntsman Mental Health Institute.

headline.main: A New Generation Stakes Out a New Path for Charitable Giving
headline.print_headline: Give Like a Rifle or a Shotgun? A Family’s Path

docs.abstract: Boeing lawyers have publicly disclosed the strategy to transfer the cases out of the U.S., which could save the company millions.
docs.snippet: Boeing lawyers have publicly disclosed the strategy to transfer the cases out of the U.S., which could save the company millions.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Boeing’s chief executive was asked by Congress last month if the company was working to get lawsuits related to the deadly crash of Lion Air Flight 610 transferred from the United States to Indonesia, where the accident occurred, he pleaded ignorance.

headline.main: Boeing Aims to Move Victim Lawsuits Abroad, but C.E.O. Says He Is Unaware
headline.print_headline: Boeing Strategy In 737 Max Case Is Move Abroad

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

docs.abstract: The city of Ruzhou spent big, then used its health care workers to raise money, as local governments look for ways to keep the economy going.
docs.snippet: The city of Ruzhou spent big, then used its health care workers to raise money, as local governments look for ways to keep the economy going.
docs.lead_paragraph: RUZHOU, China — When the call came for local doctors and nurses to step up for their troubled community, the emergency wasn’t medical. It was financial.

headline.main: How Bad Is China’s Debt? A City Hospital Is Asking Nurses for Loans

byline.original: By Alexandra Stevenson and Cao Li
